name: An Average Day (Sarah Kate Noel)
description:
DESCRIPTION:

"An Average Day," is a casual, fast-paced, sci-fi game where you play as a human just trying to get through their shift as a cashier on an alien-owned space station.  The aliens speak in glyphs, and think humans find oxygen an acceptable form of payment. Think on your feet, and don't choke!

INSTRUCTIONS:

-Click on shelves and items to fulfill the grocery lists of customers. Aliens must get their items in the exact order they requested. An item guide is provided in the in-game instructions.

-Keep an eye on your oxygen meter!

-Hit "Esc" to quit

EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK:

Congratulations !

You have been selected for the prestigious position of starship fuel station administrator. We understand humans love diatomic  oxygen. So we've made this your commission! You'll also gain other worldly experience and exposure*. And before you ask, no, you cannot trade it in for more oxygen!

-Get customers what they want from the cabinets via clicking on the shelves. 

Here at Mart 845, orbiting your homeworld of we are incredibly detail-oriented! We expect the same caliber from our employees! 

-Customers need their grocery list fulfilled in the exact order they asked. 

-Should you wish to terminate your employment press "ESC," and be ejected from the station.

CREDITS:

Team Lead & Programmer: Ashton Rowells  

Head Programmer: Sarah Kate Noel  

Programmer and Play Tester: Max Roberts 

Asset Artists: Michaela Olson, Estelle Vanthier  

Music by Gabriel Sotomayor @Oni_Music

Created by a team of six undergraduates during the Spring of 2022 at University of New Orleans. Coded in Unity 2020.3.23f1 with C#.

Warning: game contains some flashing
